messages.subject: RE: [SHQ] Anniversary of Kondou's death
messages.msgSnippet: I thought that the anniversary was in May... and Souji passed away  sometime in June/July by western calender...   Wow, if I  could I would so like to visit
messages.messageBody:
I thought that the anniversary was in May... and Souji passed away sometime in June/July by western calender... Wow, if I could I would so like to visit one the Shinsengumi's grave someday. By any chance, do we have pictures of diffrent memeber's graves? Or even the monument that Nagakura build?

-Bunneh

Hirotada Tokugawa <patriot014@...> wrote: >I visited his grave site in Fuchu today.

Oh my goodness, it's today, isn't it?

I have uploaded to the Files section a scan from the compilation "Meiji
Nyuusu Jiten." This one is of an article published in the pro-Bakufu
newspaper "Koko Shinbun," from the 4th month of 1868, describing the notice
posted at Itabashi-juku regarding Kondou's execution.

May he rest in peace.

-M.

messages.subject: Anniversary of Kondou's death
messages.msgSnippet: I visited his grave site in Fuchu today. I didn t see anybody but there were flowers that looked somebody just set.
messages.messageBody:
I visited his grave site in Fuchu today.
I didn't see anybody but there were flowers that looked somebody just set.
